title: Scheduling to Maximize the Minimum Processor Finish Time in a Multiprocessor System

pubData.venue: SIAM Journal on Algebraic Discrete Methods

description: Considers the problem of scheduling jobs on $m$ identical machines. Analyzes the approximation ratio of the LPT (longest processing time) algorithm for maximizing the MCT (minimum completion time).
results: Proves that LPT's MCT is at least $3/4$ times the maximum MCT.
Gives an example for which LPT's MCT is $(3m-1)/(4m-2)$ times the maximum MCT.
